Message.Issue: Add an implementation of GetObjectData to type 'ResourceNotFoundException'.
Implement IDisposable on 'QuadRenderer' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'Texture2D'.
Declare the second parameter of 'EffectCompletedEventHandler' as an EventArgs, or an instance of a type that extends EventArgs, named 'e'.
Declare the first parameter of 'PointNotifierEventHandler' as an object named 'sender'.
Declare the second parameter of 'PointNotifierEventHandler' as an EventArgs, or an instance of a type that extends EventArgs, named 'e'.

Implement IDisposable on 'Background' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'Texture2D'. If 'Background' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Implement IDisposable on 'Section' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'DebugForm', 'EditorForm'. If 'Section' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Declare the second parameter of 'EventHandler<int>' as an EventArgs, or an instance of a type that extends EventArgs, named 'e'.

Rule.Name: Declare event handlers correctly
Rule.Description: By convention, .NET events have two parameters that specify the event sender and event data. Event handler signatures should follow this form: void MyEventHandler(object sender, EventArgs e). The 'sender' parameter is always of type System.Object, even if it is possible to employ a more specific type. The 'e' parameter is always of type System.EventArgs. Events that do not provide event data should use the System.EventHandler delegate type. Event handlers return void so that they can send each event to multiple target methods. Any value returned by a target would be lost after the first call.
Rule.Resolution: Declare the first parameter of {0} as an object named 'sender'.
Declare the second parameter of {0} as an EventArgs, or an instance of a type that extends EventArgs, named 'e'.

Rule.Name: Implement ISerializable correctly
Rule.Description: If a type is assignable to ISerializable, it should implement GetObjectData. For unsealed types, the GetObjectData method should be callable and overridable by derived types.
Rule.Resolution: Add an implementation of GetObjectData to type {0}.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}.
